content: Hi, can you prepare a canonical vector and a pair of smearing functions?

arguments.code: DefTensor[SmearingF[-a], M3, PrintAs->"\[ScriptF]"]; DefTensor[SmearingS[-a], M3, PrintAs->"\[ScriptS]"];

content: I've defined a canonical vector field \( A[a] \) with conjugate momentum \( E[a] \), and also created the smearing functions \( \text{SmearingF}[-a] \) and \( \text{SmearingS}[-a] \).
Great, can you now compute the Poisson bracket between the canonical vector and its conjugate momentum?
